variants.Description in input context: L166P variant in DJ-1 associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells expressing wild-type and L166P mutant DJ-1.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant DJ-1 showed reduced protein stability and increased aggregation compared to wild-type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% of wild-type levels or significant aggregation detected.
